intro: Baphia bequaertii, commonly known as the African baphia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Leguminosae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces elongated, woody pods that contain several seeds. It is often found in savannah and woodland habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and for its potential ecological benefits.
